not to explain what happens but, rather, to evaluate and to determine which acts are
justified. The audience also varies from one area of argumentation to another. Some
religious reasoning is addressed only to people who already accept certain basic
claims of a religious tradition, such as that the Bible is inspired, whereas philoso-
phical reasoning typically prides itself in questioning common assumptions and
